# Course syllabus

Part I --- Foundations of psycholinguistics

- Session 1 [20/04]: What is psycholinguistics? What do psycholinguists investigate?

- Session 2 [27/04]: Investigating linguistic meaning using psycholinguistic tools

- Session 3 [04/05]: Psycholinguistic methods: An overview

- Session 4 [11/05]: Investigating language production at the discourse level

- Session 5 [18/05]: Investigating language comprehension at the discourse level

- Session 6 [25/05]: Investigating the relation between production and comprehension

- Session 7 [08/06]: How to read and interpret a scientific paper

Part II --- Selected readings

- Session 8 [15/06]: Production studies

- Session 9 [22/06]: Self-paced reading studies

- Session 10 [29/06]: Visual world eye-tracking studies

- Session 11 [06/07]: Mouse-tracking studies

- Session 12 [13/07]: The production-comprehension interface
